benchmark_details.name: AgentEval
benchmark_details.overview: AgentEval is a novel framework designed to simplify the utility verification process of LLM-powered applications by automatically proposing criteria tailored to the application's purpose and assessing the utility against these criteria.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the alignment between application behavior and end-user goals, providing insights for application developers to improve functionality.

data.source: Open-source datasets, specifically the MATH dataset and ALFWorld
data.size: 12,500 problems for MATH dataset, 134 tasks for ALFWorld
data.annotation: Automatically generated criteria based on task description and examples of task execution.

methodology.calculation: Task utility is assessed based on suggested criteria by the CriticAgent and quantified by the QuantifierAgent.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better alignment with user goals and utility in accomplishing tasks.
methodology.validation: Criteria effectiveness is validated through task-specific assessments across multiple dataset scenarios.
